user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_callback:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_callback (uint64_t size,
                                   size_t block_size,
                                   MHD_ContentReaderCallback crc,
                                   void *crc_cls,
                                   MHD_ContentReaderFreeCallback crfc)
{
  struct MHD_Response *response;

  if ((NULL == crc) || (0 == block_size))
    return NULL;
  if (NULL == (response = MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response)
                                       + block_size)))
    return NULL;
  response->fd = -1;
  response->data = (void *) &response[1];
  response->data_buffer_size = block_size;
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  if (! MHD_mutex_init_ (&response->mutex))
  {
    free (response);
    return NULL;
  }
#endif
  response->crc = crc;
  response->crfc = crfc;
  response->crc_cls = crc_cls;
  response->reference_count = 1;
  response->total_size = size;
  return response;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found. None of the function parameters (size, block_size, crc, crc_cls, crfc) are assigned to or otherwise modified inside the function. The code only reads these parameters (checks crc and block_size for NULL/zero, passes block_size to allocation, and stores pointer values into members of the newly allocated response structure). Storing a pointer parameter value into a structure member does not modify the parameter itself. There are no dereferences or assignments that alter the objects of pointer parameters via the parameter variable. Therefore no fragments need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
